text.0: ye aśvins hither come to us nāsatyas be not disinclined.
text.1: fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
text.2: o aśvins like a pair of deer like two wild cattle to the mead.
text.3: fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
text.4: o aśvins rich in gifts accept our sacrifice to prosper it.
text.5: fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.
text.6: as atri when descending to the cavern called on you loudly like a wailing woman.
text.7: ye came to him o aśvins with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.
text.8: tree part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child.
text.9: ye aśvins listen to my call loose saptavadhri from his bonds.
text.10: for saptavadhri for the seer affrighted when he wept and wailed.
text.11: ye aśvins with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.
text.12: like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses.
text.13: so stir in thee the babe unborn so may the tenmonth babe descend.
text.14: like as the wind like as the wood like as the sea is set astir.
text.15: so also tenmonth babe descend together with the afterbirth.
text.16: the child who hath for ten months time been lying in his mothers side.
text.17: may he come forth alive unharmed yea living from the living dame.
